summary: "Las Meninas" is a famous painting by Diego Velázquez, a Spanish artist from the 1600s. It shows a scene in a royal palace with many people, including a young princess and her servants. Some characters look at us, while others interact. Velázquez even painted himself working on a big canvas. The painting is special because it plays with reality and makes us think about how we see things. Many art experts think it's one of the best paintings ever made.
title: Las Meninas
